results.title: Research methods
results.creator_credit: Robert Aller and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Psychology: the study of human behavior”.
Poor research methods can lead to disastrous consequences as illustrated by the early use of lobotomies without adequate investigation of their effect, and also by Bruno Bettelheim’s belief in the destructive mother as the cause of autism. Correct scientific research methods which involve random selection and the use of control groups is illustrated in the applied research into improving methods of criminal investigation interviewing techniques.

results.title: Research in the atmosphere (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Film Graphics and National Aeronautics and Space Administration
results.brief_description: Traces the methods of exploring the upper atmosphere and near-earth environment from ancient times until the present, with emphasis on research with balloons and sounding rockets.

results.title: Research and modern housing
results.creator_credit: Julian Wintle, Verity Films and Richard F. Tambling
results.brief_description: Describes the work and experiments carried out at the Building Research Station of the Department of Scientific and Industrial Research, England. Shows new ideas for better, cheaper and quicker building techniques and the way this is helping to solve postwar housing problems in Britain.

results.title: Rescue by helicopter
results.creator_credit: John Martin-Jones, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Australia. Royal Australian Navy and Bern Gandy
results.brief_description: Standard procedures for rescue by a helicopter. Vertical take off and landing, and the ability to hover make it a valuable rescue craft. Shows correct method of approach, putting on the rescue strap, and giving the winding signal. Provided rules are adhered to helicopter rescue is quite safe. Edited by Richard Mitchell.

results.title: Rescue 036
results.creator_credit: Greg Parry and Australia. Dept. of Defence. Public Relations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sentinel”.
The Army Aviation Centre at Oakey, Queensland, has more helicopter movements per year than any other airfield in Australia. Therefore the potential of aircraft accidents is great. The Army Aviation Corps have devised a crash rescue system designed to provide medical assistance to crash victims in the shortest possible time.

results.title: Requiem for a faith
results.creator_credit: Irving Hartley, Hartley Productions and Elda Hartley
results.brief_description: The traditional life of Tibet is depicted by Huston Smith, Professor of Philosophy at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. Smith shows the extent to which traditional customs have been invaded and corroded by the West. All social and economic activity revolves around religious practice. The importance of the Dalai Lama is emphasised. Set in Gyuto Tantric Monastery in Northern India, this moving film explores the essence of Tibetan Buddhism and focuses on the unusual chants of the Gyuto monks, whose training enables them to chant in chords. The film was shot mainly in Dalhousie, India, where the two Tantric Colleges, Gyuto and Gyume, were re-established in exile.

results.title: Repulsion motor principles
results.creator_credit: United States. Office of Education and Ray-Bell Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Electrical work: electrical machinery”.
Explains construction of repulsion motor, rotor circuits and effects of brush position; short-circuiting and brush-lifting mechanism; and application of repulsion motors. This film is a technical training film on the design and construction of repulsion brush type electric A.C. motors as used in the first half of this century.

results.title: Republic day: India
results.creator_credit: Ezra Mir and Films Division, Government of India
results.brief_description: The celebrations in Delhi on India’s national day, 26th January. The President drives in State to take the salute at a parade of armed forces, floats representing the various provinces and industries, folk dances and marching schoolchildren. Illuminations and fireworks enliven the city at night. The following day a fold dance festival shows the dances of many districts. The military ceremony of Beating the Retreat concludes the festivities.
